wikipedia_page.main: Richard William Leslie Wain VC (5 December 1896 – 20 November 1917) was a Welsh recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: *20 November – Richard William Leslie Wain, VC recipient, 20 (killed in action)

link_mentions.page: List of Welsh Victoria Cross recipients of World War I

response: * Richard William Leslie Wain, soldier, awarded the Victoria Cross
* Richard William Leslie Wain VC (1896 – 1917) – Captain in the Tank Corps and recipient of the Victoria Cross

link_mentions.page: List of people associated with Penarth
response: * Richard William Leslie Wain VC (5 December 1896 – 20 November 1917) – a Captain in the Tank Corps was a recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces, was born and educated in Penarth.
*Richard William Leslie Wain (1896–1917), Welsh recipient of the Victoria Cross
